title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.9 | 05-04-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma Deva was the best amongst the eight Vasus received and welcomed all the great and powerful Rishis who were assembled there and knew perfectly all the religious principles according to time and place
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.9.9) that will be discussed, focusing on Bhishma Deva's qualities and his understanding of religious principles.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma Deva is going to quit his body thinking of Krishna glorifying Krishna and it is Bhishma's good fortune that Krishna is right in front of him
segments.summary: The speaker explains the context of the verse, describing Bhishma Deva's impending departure from the body in the presence of Krishna and the assembled Rishis.

segments.key_quote: Expert religionist know perfectly well how to adjust religious principles in terms of time and place
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the importance of adjusting religious principles according to time and place, citing Srila Prabhupada and other Acharyas as examples.

segments.key_quote: Srila Prabhupada he introduced deity worship he taught the devotees how to in the western countries how to cook different preparations for offering to the Lord and accepting his prasadam but he did not compromise on the fundamental principles
segments.summary: The speaker provides a specific example of Srila Prabhupada's adaptation of Krishna consciousness in the West, focusing on deity worship and food offerings.

segments.key_quote: Vishwadeva he is described as Vasuttama he is the best of the eight Vasus
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Bhishma Deva's identity as Vishwadeva, one of the Vasus, and his status as one of the twelve Mahajanas, authorities on dharma.

segments.key_quote: The eternal religious principles are a very big mystery for even the most learned Vedic scholars
segments.summary: The speaker explains the difficulty in understanding the essence of dharma, even for Vedic scholars, and the importance of focusing on essential principles for spiritual advancement.

segments.key_quote: Srila Prabhupada has taught us the most essential principles which are absolutely required to make advancement in Krishna Consciousness without spending too much time in preliminaries
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes Srila Prabhupada's focus on essential principles for Krishna consciousness, using the example of cleanliness (external and internal) to illustrate the point.

segments.key_quote: One becomes completely purified externally and internally by simply remembering the lotus side supreme god
segments.summary: The speaker highlights the purifying power of chanting Hare Krishna and how Srila Prabhupada simplified the process of spiritual advancement, enabling devotees to return to Godhead.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma Deva he is one of the twelve great authorities mahajanas
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates Bhishma Deva's position as one of the twelve Mahajanas, emphasizing his knowledge of religious principles and his ability to welcome the assembled sages.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma Deva as a pure devotee he need not choose an auspicious time for quitting the body neither he has to choose an auspicious place because he is a pure devotee he is guaranteed to go back to Godhead
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Bhishma Deva's benediction to choose the time of his death and contrasts the importance of auspicious timing for non-devotees versus the guaranteed liberation of devotees regardless of time or place of death.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma Deva he quit his body in the presence of Krishna glorifying Krishna fixing his complete attention on Krishna at the time of his death
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing that Bhishma Deva, despite being a pure devotee, waited for an auspicious moment to depart, setting an example for others, and ultimately achieved liberation by focusing on Krishna at the time of death.
